keyword: low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can
title: Low-Calorie Alcoholic Drinks in a Can
meta_description: Discover low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can with around 100 kcal per serving, including carbs, nutrition facts, and tips for lighter choices.
h1: Low-Calorie Alcoholic Drinks in a Can
assumptions: Typical hard seltzer or light alcoholic beverage in a 355 ml (12 oz) can, 5% ABV, minimal sugars; examples include brands like White Claw or Truly.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, ABV, and can size. Alcohol content affects calories; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard low-calorie alcoholic drink in a can has about 100 kcal, mostly from alcohol with minimal carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with canned beverages.

tweaks.label: Switch to a zero-sugar light beer (e.g., Michelob Ultra)
Opt for a flavored vodka soda seltzer with fruit essence
Choose a higher ABV version (7% vs. 5%)

faqs.q: What are some low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can?
faqs.a: Popular options include hard seltzers like White Claw (100 kcal) and light beers like Bud Light (95-110 kcal) per 355 ml can.

faqs.q: How many calories in low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can?
faqs.a: Typically 90-110 kcal per 355 ml can, depending on the brand and type.

faqs.q: Do low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can have carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, but lowâ€”usually 1-3 g carbs per can, with little to no fiber or sugars.

faqs.q: Are there sugar-free low-calorie alcoholic drinks in a can?
faqs.a: Many are, like zero-sugar hard seltzers, keeping calories under 100 from alcohol alone.

faqs.q: How does can size affect calories in low-calorie alcoholic drinks?
faqs.a: Smaller cans (e.g., 250 ml) have fewer calories (~70-80 kcal); larger 500 ml cans double it to ~180-200 kcal.
